intro: Trichoscypha africana, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by fleshy, orange-red fruits that contain seeds. It is adapted to seasonal climates and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various animals.
